conclusion: Consider principles of light and shadow for changes in shadows A, B, C, and D.
Image shows four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D.
Light source is positioned such that shadows are cast in the direction shown.
Moving light source to back left causes shadows to move to front right and elongate.
Shadows increase in size due to more acute angle between light source and objects.
Moving light source to back right causes shadows to move to front left and elongate.
Shadows increase in size for same reason as moving to back left.
Shadow A moves to front right and elongates when light moves to back left.
Shadow A moves to front left and elongates when light moves to back right.
Shadow B moves to front right and elongates when light moves to back left.
Shadow B moves to front left and elongates when light moves to back right.
Shadow C moves to front right and elongates when light moves to back left.
Shadow C moves to front left and elongates when light moves to back right.
Shadow D moves to front right and elongates when light moves to back left.
Shadow D moves to front left and elongates when light moves to back right.
Final answer: Shadows move to front right when light moves to back left, and to front left when light moves to back right, elongating in both cases.
